Echoes.title: Echoes
Echoes.description: Aboard South’s pirate ship, we’ve been sailing the misty seas, steering the world of creative writing and visual  arts since 1976. Queen-Elizabeth-II-s-legacy.title: Queen Elizabeth II’s legacy
Queen-Elizabeth-II-s-legacy.description:
Queen Elizabeth II,the longest reigning monarch in British history, according to the BBC, died on Sept. 8, 2022 at the age of 96 after 70 years on the throne. She left behind a remarkable legacy, one that is both respected and controversial.

Fifteenth-state-to-pass-New-Voices-Law.title: Fifteenth state to pass New Voices Law
Fifteenth-state-to-pass-New-Voices-Law.description:
On Dec. 21, 2021, New Jersey became the 15th state to pass the New Voices Law.
According to the New Jersey Education Association, the New Voices Law is a student-driven movement of activists seeking rights for school press. The supporters of this law include students and advocates in various fields

Jewish-American-Heritage-Month-Celebrati.description:

Appreciation-on-Air.title: Appreciation on Air
Appreciation-on-Air.description:
Teachers have worked hard throughout the school year to make South the best it can be. Many have taught at South for several years. Recently, their efforts were recognized through the Teacher Appreciation Week shows that aired on South’s radio station WWPH 107.9 FM.

Remembering-Chernobyl.title: Remembering Chernobyl
Remembering-Chernobyl.description: The Chernobyl reactor meltdown in Ukraine occurred 36 years ago on April 26, 1986, marking one of the most destructive nuclear disasters in history. The stories of people who lived through that history are essential to remembering what occurred there, especially as people are looking at Ukraine agai

Teacher--inspiration--friend--Special-Ed.title: Teacher, inspiration, friend: Special Ed. teacher Ms. Kerry Kemo awarded Educator of the Year
Teacher--inspiration--friend--Special-Ed.description:
“It’s a really great honor,” said Kerry Kemo, South’s 2022 Educator of the Year awardee.
     The annual WW-P Educator of the Year award is a distinction given to one teacher in every WW-P school to highlight their hard work and dedication throughout the school year. The selection process inclu

Honoring-Black-Voices.title: Honoring Black Voices
Honoring-Black-Voices.description:
In “Letter from Birmingham Jail,” published in 1963, Martin Luther King Jr. said, “Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.”

National-History-Day-Teacher-of-the-Year.title: National History Day Teacher of the Year: Mr. Garzio
National-History-Day-Teacher-of-the-Year.description:
This February, beloved history teacher Mike Garzio was named the 2022 New Jersey National History Day (NHD) High School Teacher of the Year, a prestigious award sponsored by the 30-year old NHD program, a nationwide wide competition where students create year-long history projects.

Big-changes-to-the-SAT.title: Big changes to the SAT
Big-changes-to-the-SAT.description:
Last January 25 the College Board announced that the Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT) will go digital in 2024, debuting internationally first in the spring of 2023.

A-Nonfungible-trend.description: At first glance, people assume nonfungible tokens (NFTs) are just random paintings sold online. 10-Key-Moments-Leading-Up-To-The-Ukraine.description: On Feb 24, 2022, Russia began a full-scale invasion of Ukraine, the largest military attack on a European state since World War II. Masks-off-.title: Masks off?
Masks-off-.description:
Recently, Gov. Phil Murphy announced that NJ schools have the option to lift the state mask mandate starting March 7.  “This is not a declaration of victory as much as an acknowledgment that we can responsibly live with this thing,” said Gov. Murphy in an article by The New York Times.

Knitting-and-writing---two-new-clubs.title: Knitting and writing — two new clubs
Knitting-and-writing---two-new-clubs.description:
School ends at 2:50 p.m., but South’s halls still buzz with liveliness and some classrooms become packed again with students. After 2:50, school officially opens for after-school club activities.

Pirates-missing-from-their-ships--studen.title: Pirates missing from their ships: students absent during study hall
Pirates-missing-from-their-ships--studen.description:

Spotted-lanternflies--vivid-creepers.description: With an amber colored body, a pair of peppered wings, speckled with a mosaic of red, black, and white, the spotted lanternfly might try its best to deceive you into thinking it is an exotic creature, but this vibrant insect is actually a widespread invasive species. South-s-response-to-Covid-19.title: South’s response to Covid-19
South-s-response-to-Covid-19.description:
As the pandemic continues, South’s administration has taken many precautionary measures to create a clean and secure environment for everyone, from more seating areas to sanitization stations.

Esports-makes-its-full-time-debut-at-Sou.description:
It’s a growing sensation around the world. Esports are captivating the attention of young adults everywhere. Now, that trend has come to South.

A-new-era-of-social-justice.description: Exploring different perspectives is at the heart of Brian Levinson’s new Social Justice class. Looking-into-the-future-South.title: Looking into the future South
Looking-into-the-future-South.description:
Passing by South, it’s impossible not to notice the half-finished building that takes up most of the front entrance. But when stepping inside our school, it’s a lot harder to notice the various internal construction areas because they are mostly hidden behind closed doors.

Intense-storms--A-consequence-of-climate.title: Intense storms: A consequence of climate change
Intense-storms--A-consequence-of-climate.description:
From Sept. 1 to 2, the WW-P area was drenched with over 4.5 inches of rain the days Hurricane Ida hit, according to nj.com.
The remnants of Hurricane Ida, a category four hurricane that traveled over eight states damaged vehicles and roofs, downed power lines leading to lengthy power outages and flo

Farewell-to-our-original-Pirate--Mr--Con.title: Farewell to our original Pirate: Mr. Conner retires
Farewell-to-our-original-Pirate--Mr--Con.description: A teacher, a Vietnam war veteran, a father, a grandfather, a husband, a coach, and a devoted Pirate — social studies teacher Walt Conner has sailed aboard our pirate ship since 1975. On Oct. 29, after 46 years, he stepped off our ship, leaving behind an unforgettable legacy. Before he left to embark

African-American-Parent-Support-Group-Mo.title: African American Parent Support Group Mounts New Heights
African-American-Parent-Support-Group-Mo.description:
This summer, the African American Parent Support Group (AAPSG) is offering a virtual summer math program for African American students.  The program begins July 7.
     AAPSG arranges programs, events and meetings to support African American students through their high school career.

Passing-on-the-torch--Mr--Lepold-retires.title: Passing on the torch: Mr. Lepold retires
Passing-on-the-torch--Mr--Lepold-retires.description:
Holding the position of Principal at South for nine years and guiding WW-P schools for many more, Mr. Lepold will retire at the end of the school year and pass the torch to Jessica Cincotta, an Assistant Principal at North. Here, Mr. Lepold reflects on his years at South.

New-Jersey-Sees-a-Rise-in-Anti-Asian-Bia.title: New Jersey Sees a Rise in Anti-Asian Bias Incidents
New-Jersey-Sees-a-Rise-in-Anti-Asian-Bia.description: In 2020, New Jersey citizens were plagued by both the coronavirus pandemic and another equally deadly disease: the rise of anti-Asian bias incidents. Because 63 percent of students at South are of Asian, Pacific Islander or Native Hawaiian background this is an issue that concerns our school.

Student-vaccinations-happening-in-full-s.title: Student vaccinations happening in full swing
Student-vaccinations-happening-in-full-s.description:
On May 10, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) gave emergency approval to make the Pfizer Biontech vaccine available to 12 to 15-year-olds. The WWPRSD initiated vaccine clinics.

A-New-South.description:
Gallery|4 Photos

Use-of-plastic-skyrockets.title: Use of plastic skyrockets
Use-of-plastic-skyrockets.description:
“Before COVID-19, I think a lot of countries and a lot of groups were really trying to reduce our reliance on single-use plastics,” said senior Raghunandan Raman, co-president of the Environmental Club.

Mail-in-ballots--Fraudulent-or-safe-.description:
During the 2020 election, amid claims of fraud and malpractice of the mail-in ballot voting process, a heated debate emerged: was the voter’s voice counted? The data collected so far says yes, as long as people followed the correct procedures for voting by mail.

     “MidKnight!”

FAQs-about-the-Mueller-Report.title: FAQs about the Mueller Report
FAQs-about-the-Mueller-Report.description:
Who is Robert Mueller?

     Robert Mueller is a lawyer, U.S government official and former director of the Federal Bureau of Investigations (FBI) from 2001 to 2013. He and his team, that included experts from FBI and the Department of Justice, investigated and wrote the report that bears his name.

College-admissions-scandal--how-far-will.title: College admissions scandal: how far will money get you?
College-admissions-scandal--how-far-will.description:

Senior-Annabel-Azaro-leads-Zumba-lessons.title: Senior Annabel Azaro leads Zumba lessons in gym class
Senior-Annabel-Azaro-leads-Zumba-lessons.description:
The students finish the last few moves of the dance, looking at the leader, senior Annabel Azaro. After the song finishes, the out-of-breath participants smile, applaud each other and give high-fives.

Youth-plaintiffs-sue-federal-government-.title: Youth plaintiffs sue federal government over climate change
Youth-plaintiffs-sue-federal-government-.description:
Every day our Earth suffers a little more. Our atmosphere clouds, our oceans rise and we don’t spare a second’s thought towards it. We live on a dying planet and a youth-led court case is trying to do something about it.

Afternoon-prayer-available-during-school.title: Afternoon prayer available during school hours for Ramadan
Afternoon-prayer-available-during-school.description:
For the first time during Ramadan, Muslim students at South have the opportunity to pray Dhuhr, an obligatory afternoon prayer that falls during school hours. The Muslim Students Association (MSA) was recently formed so students would be able to pray in the afternoon during Ramadan.

Senior-physics-students-win-national-NAS.title: Senior physics students win national NASA essay contest
Senior-physics-students-win-national-NAS.description:
The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) offers an annual essay writing contest called Scientist for a Day.
This year’s writing prompt asked students to choose among three moons and argue which one NASA should explore.
The three choices were Saturn’s moon Titan, Jupiter’s moon Europa

Changes-in-PARCC-testing-criteria.title: Changes in PARCC testing criteria
Changes-in-PARCC-testing-criteria.description: Implementation of a new state assessment and graduation requirement for all high school students began back in 2016, when the PARCC (Partnership for Assessment and Readiness for College and Careers) replaced the HSPA (High School Proficiency Assessment) exam for 11th graders. Deer-hunt-sparks-controversy.title: Deer hunt sparks controversy
Deer-hunt-sparks-controversy.description: For the first time, Mercer County Park held a deer hunt from Oct. 27, 2018 through Feb. 16, 2019 to control the deer population, a practice that is often called “deer management.” The hunting season was semi-controlled. This means that only parts of the park were open to hunters with a 75-foot

Women-s-March---Hey-hey--ho-ho--This-is-.title: Women’s March: “Hey hey, ho ho! This is what democracy looks like.”
Women-s-March---Hey-hey--ho-ho--This-is-.description:
People all over the world poured into city streets to rally for women’s rights and equality for the annual Women’s March on Jan. 19.
     The march united women globally to fight against misogynistic and patriarchal power structures deeply rooted in society. This march gave protestors a forum to

Dr--Michael-Fowlin-addresses-mental-heal.title: Dr. Michael Fowlin addresses mental health in high school with one-man performance
Dr--Michael-Fowlin-addresses-mental-heal.description:
Dr. Michael Fowlin, better known as Mykee, merged his skills as a performer with his expertise in psychology in his programs at South and GMS in January, which was hosted by WWP.
     By playing different characters on stage, Mykee told stories of how mental illness can affect anyone. Each chara

South-Black-History-Month-exhibit-celebr.title: South Black History Month exhibit celebrates Civil Rights Movement and African-American culture
South-Black-History-Month-exhibit-celebr.description:
Black History Month shines a spotlight on the struggles and achievements of African-Americans to recognize that their stories are interwoven into the narrative of America.         
     South hosted a Black History Museum from Jan. 31 to Feb. 4 in the school’s library. The event was coordinated

Falling-apart--will-Britain-leave-the-Eu.title: Falling apart: will Britain leave the European Union?
Falling-apart--will-Britain-leave-the-Eu.description: In the final weeks of November, Prime Minister Theresa May traveled to the European Commission in Brussels for negotiations at an Emergency Summit. The Summit’s purpose was to craft an exit agreement for her country, the United Kingdom (U.K.), from the European Union (E.U.), as well as agreement

First-Student-Unconference--success.title: First Student Unconference: success
First-Student-Unconference--success.description:
What do you think of when you hear the word unconference? Freshman Aaravsinh Solanki said, “(it’s) an informal teaching” that brings students into conversations. Students learn and are given the opportunity to inform others about topics they enjoy.

Grover-s-Mill-celebrates-the-80th-annive.title: Grover’s Mill celebrates the 80th anniversary of false report about Martian landing
Grover-s-Mill-celebrates-the-80th-annive.description:
Aliens, terror, mass panic: Martians landed on Earth, in a farmer’s field in Grover’s Mill, on October 30, 1938. The small community of Grover’s Mill had a frightening experience and is a historical event that is still known today. 
     It was a typical Sunday evening before World War II. Peop

Shooting-at-Jersey-Garden-Mall.title: Shooting at Jersey Garden Mall
Shooting-at-Jersey-Garden-Mall.description:
A shooting at The Mills at Jersey Gardens mall in New Jersey occurred on Black Friday, Nov. 23. One man was injured, and the gunman remained at large until he was found dead on Nov. 30. This is one of the 340 mass shootings that occurred in 2018 according to the Gun Violence Archive.

South-helps-families-in-Mercer-County-Co.title: South helps families in Mercer County Community through annual Holiday Drive
South-helps-families-in-Mercer-County-Co.description:
The holidays are a time to spread cheer and celebrate as a community. At South, we have have the opportunity to help others in our community and make their holidays more joyous. 
     From December 5 to December 20, South held its annual holiday drive. The club Pirates Against Hunger helped org

Deadliest-wildfire-in-California-made-hi.title: Deadliest wildfire in California made history
Deadliest-wildfire-in-California-made-hi.description: On Nov. 26 2018, the Camp Fire, a wildfire in Butte County that devastated northern California, was finally contained after 14 days. The San Francisco Chronicle reported that, as of December 13, Camp Fire, killed 86 civilians and firefighters, injured 17 and three people remain unaccounted for.

Math-curriculum-change-for-freshmen.title: Math curriculum change for freshmen
Math-curriculum-change-for-freshmen.description: “I really want to take Algebra 2 honors next year, but I think I forgot everything,” a freshman told her friend in the dim glow of Monday morning study hall last June. Climate-change-impacts-New-Jersey.title: Climate change impacts New Jersey
Climate-change-impacts-New-Jersey.description: “Why is the weather so bizarre?” asked Tracy D’Souza, a sophomore at South. “There’re several rainy days, then one sunny day, then rainy days again. What’s going on?” Some at South believe Hurricane Florence is the cause. This change in weather patterns provokes more serious storms, according t

Seeing-double--College-Board-faces-backl.title: Seeing double: College Board faces backlash for reused reading passages in August SAT
Seeing-double--College-Board-faces-backl.description:
SAT test takers across the United States were in an uproar after the August test. The College Board, a non-profit organization that distributes standardized testing for college applications, was accused of allegedly re-using an international reading passage on the summer test.
